text: Hello. I'm a UX Designer for a small company doing both designs and development for their new website. I was wondering if anyone knew a way to sync the custom modules from HubSpot into the *local* hubl server?
<@UMBFA316K> you can use `fetch` to get all the modules you want from design manager into your local env
The docs have been helpful for me as I am learning these commands: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/local-development-reference>
If you are worried about version issues, you can `--overwrite` your local files during the fetch to get them up to date with your design manager files.

i have only used `--overwrite` once so I would be sure of which files are the most up to date before overwriting them all unless you are handling version control with git or something :slightly_smiling_face:
I'm having a little trouble rendering the custom modules in other hubl `{% module "module_15656297764774" path="/_eflex/dist/components/testing", label="global_header" %}` in my local server?
There doesn't seem to be an error in the inspector
Although there's a `custom widget definition not found` in the markup
the current version of the local hubl server doesn't support the `.module` directory format of files returned by the `fetch` command.
